features: 【Alycolic Acid 7% Toner】Glycolic Acid 7% Toning Resurfacing Solution blemishes and acne, Say goodbye to enlarged pores! Glycolic acid Toning Solution helps to minimize the appearance of pores, giving your skin a smoother and more refined texture.
【Clears Acne 】Toning Resurfacing Solution improves blemishes and acne, gently rejuvenates skin, evens skin tone, and provides a smooth and soft texture.
【 Moisturize Effectively】Glycolic Acid 7% Toning Solution moisturizes and strengthens the skin barrier, improves blemishes and acne, shrinks pores, and gently exfoliates.
【Professional Pore Minimizing】 Say goodbye to enlarged pores! It hydrates the skin without clogging pores or making skin look oily or shiny.
【Suitable Skin Type】Dry skin, oily skin, combination skin, mature skin. Not applicable to sensitive ,peeling or damaged skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I didn't expect this to be The Ordinary brand but that's what I received. It's darker in color than what it normally is, but I can say that I've seen variations in color in the past from that brand of product, as well. It works the same, and it was factory sealed in original packaging for the ordinary. I'm comfortable saying that I received a name brand product and it is exactly what I expected for it to be for that brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Ordinary Toning Solution
reviews.reviewText: The Ordinary toner has been very gentle on my skin. I have very sensitive skin and have to be extremely careful when choosing a toner. This one has been perfect. It leaves my skin feeling clean and hydrated. It has almost no smell. I have been using it every day for the past week and it has had no adverse interactions with my oils or lotions. It feels cool and fresh when I apply it.I have been very satisfied with this toner so far and I will continue to use it. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Confused about what this is.
reviews.reviewText: The listing has no branding in the photos. It looked like a The Ordinary copycat, but did NOT use the name in the photos or description.However, the bottle I got has all the normal The Ordinary branding. Packaging has same info. Packaged the same way as the ones I've bought from The Ordinary.This is the "glycolic acid 7% toning solution". (The Ordinary has renamed it as "glycolic acid 7% exfoliating toner " but I don't know if they have updated boxes and bottles yet. On their website their product photos are NOT updated but the name of the product IS updated.)So everything is correct when I compare it. I'm not noticing any difference using it. It is darker toned than my current The Ordinary bottle. But I've experienced some color variations in previous The Ordinary bottles. Anywhere from almost white to a yellow color.But, what is it? The product doesn't match the photos, or the product description, and with the extensive the Ordinary branding, I just don't know what to think.Giving three stars because it seems to work fine (so far it works just like The Ordinary I have at home already) but I'm unsure if it's real or not.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Working well so far
reviews.reviewText: This toner works pretty well so far for me. I have given it a week before reviewing and so far I have had no reactions to it and my skin is beginning to feel better overall. I do glycolic peels every month on my skin and this is a great daily addition to that routine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Feels good on my skin
reviews.reviewText: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Toner comes in a bottle with a regular cap. It also has a twist open spout that is packaged in the box in an ingenious way.The toner has a very light scent, that dissipates immediately. It feels good on the skin. I use it on my bumpy chin to hopefully clear it up.The Toning Solution is made up of the 7% Glycolic acid, Amino Acids, Aloe Vera, Ginseng and something called Tasmanian Pepperberry, that is a new one to me.Be sure to wear a sunscreen when using this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I use this toner before, and this is very different. It's not real.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Mixed feelings about this product
reviews.reviewText: First of all, when this product was ordered, there was no branding, however, when it arrived, it had “The Ordinary” branding on it on a beat up box. Secondly, the color of the actual toner looks different (darker) to the ordinary toner, which makes me really question the authenticity of this products. After using it 5 times so far, I haven’t had any irritation or allergic reactions on my face but I’m still skeptical, considering the other factors. Most importantly, I haven’t noticed any difference in my skin since I’ve started using it. It doesn’t really smell like the Ordinary toner either so it makes me question if this is indeed a counterfeit product. This is also priced a little cheaper than the Ordinary one. I would not recommend this specific product, considering the factors above.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this because I liked the ingredients listed in the description (particularly glycolic acid and aloe). I don't really care about brand names or anything, and I usually just get my skin products based on ingredients instead of brand. I took a picture of the full list of ingredients so you know what you're getting in case you're curious about all the ingredients, like me. The product didn't cause any irritation and it does not have any odor, so both of those things are good. However, it didn't really feel like it was doing anything to my skin either. There was no tingling or anything. I guess time will tell. I did not like it all that there was no safety seal on the bottle and the carton was smudged/dirty.
